comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: According to this 17/01/1924 SMH newspaper report, the above sketch was the original of three designs by Bradfield, known as the cantilever. The suspension bridge (see SLNSW link above) thought not to be capable of carrying heavy loads (trains etc). New techniques in carbon steel manufacture enabled the possibility of a considerably lighter single span arch, as built. Read all about it - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/1231139 .
